oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Map of southern Germany and northern Switzerland
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Map of southern Germany and northern Switzerland showing the route George W. Puryear took on his escape from the POW camp at Villingen, Germany. Villingen is circled on the map. The places where he stopped to sleep are also circled, and the date in October 1918 when he stopped there is written next to each circle. There are two X's across the Rhine from Waldshut, marking where he came out of the river and the house where he was first given aid.

After completing pilot training at Issoudun and gunnery school at Cazaux, Puryear served a few months as a ferry pilot before joining the 95th Aero Squadron on July 16, 1918. He was taken prisoner on July 26 and, after spending time in several POW camps, arrived at Villingen, Germany on September 15. Mass escape attempt made from camp on October 6. On October 11, Puryear swam across Rhine River at Waldshut, Germany to reach Switzerland, becoming first American officer in World War I to successfully escape from a German POW camp.
